column182:
Maria - I cannot find the minimum unit size, floor-to-area ratio, or max stories allowed for housing in this district. This seems to be a common problem with VA Beach zoning. 

Audrey -- For districts with SF/1-family housing as the only allowed treatment, you will not find minimum unit size. FAR (floor-to-area) or max stories is sometimes also not included, so that is ok if you don't see it in VB or other Jurisdictions for Single Family residential districts! Also, I'm going to talk to Eric about this, but I *think* ADUS might be allowed here because of the smaller paragraph (b) below permitted uses. Don't worry about it, I'm just explaining why I added that and I'll take care of it. Once you read my response to you, just send this back for review and I'll finish it up.
column183:
The city council may grant a conditional use permit to allow residential development at a density greater than that which is permitted by right. The following regulations shall apply to residential development outside of the Interfacility Traffic Area in the AG-1 and AG-2 Agricultural Districts pursuant to this section. Max density may be 1 DU per 5 acres or 1 DU per 10 acres dependent on soil conditions. (§ 405.)

Regarding flex suites (ADUs): "No flex suite may be constructed or occupied in any dwelling unless (i) the owner of record personally resides in such dwelling, (ii) the dwelling in which the flex suite is located is occupied by a person or group of persons meeting the definition of "family" set forth in section 111, or (iii) the flex suite or dwelling in which it is located is occupied by at least one (1) person who is sixty-two (62) years of age or older or disabled..." (§ 507.(b)(3))

column166: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit
column183: The AICUZ applies only to discretionary development of any properties located within an Accident Potential Zone (APZ) or 65-70 dB DNL, 70—75 dB DNL or >75 dB DNL Noise Zone. Certain residential uses have been deemed incompatible with certain areas and applications will be denied if they are not compatible.

column183: The purpose of the HK Overlay District is to enhance the appearance and maintain the historic vitality of the Kempsville area. It allows for multiple-family dwellings (3+ Family) and attached dwellings (townhomes) in the B-4K Mixed Use District to be permitted in the B-4K District as conditional uses requiring a public hearing.

column183:
The purpose of the Old Beach Overlay District is to preserve and enhance the historic status of the Old Beach neighborhood as one of the first residential areas within the Oceanfront Resort Area by providing opportunities for both new and redeveloped resort residential development, characterized by single-family cottage-style homes and compatible multiple-family residential dwellings. Furthermore, the Old Beach Design Guidelines are provided for this district, the purpose of which is to encourage development that is appropriate for the district.

The OB Overlay District permits single-family dwellings and ancillary single-family dwellings as a principal use where not allowed in the underlying zoning district.

column166: N/A
column183: The Oceanfront Resort District follows a Form-Based Code (FBC), which can be found here: https://www.vbgov.com/government/departments/sga/projects/Documents/20171205-ORDFBC.pdf

column183:
1-Family Treatment single-family attached (townhomes) require conditional use permit (public hearing).

The maximum density for single family attached dwellings shall be twelve (12) dwelling units per acre. The maximum number of attached dwellings constructed in one group without side yard setbacks shall be six (6).

column182: Might want to consider creating a separate district that is B-4 (SD) to account for these differences.
column183: In the SD Overlay District, multiple-family dwellings (3+ Family) and attached dwellings/townhomes in the B-4 District require a conditional use permit. Duplexes are permitted as a principal use in the B-4 District, whereas they are prohibited elsewhere in the city.

column183: Short term rentals (STRs) are allowed within the STR Overlay and are subject to the provisions of § 241.2. and § 2303.
